column2: Terry, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My GP doc raved about Forteo so I took it for 5 months.  At 4-5 months, I started having lower back pain.  When I had to go to the ER for severe back pain w/"sciatica," at 5 months on Forteo, I stopped the drug.  Still have the pain off and on.  Might be caused by Forteo?  My ortho doc said to stop it.  My lumbar xray showed disc malformed & pressing on disc.  No conclusion but too coincidental for MY comfort?

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I used Forteo for two years with very little improvement. Blood tests indicated Celiac disease.  Dr. likes Forteo but suspects ingredients may contain gluten.  Does the drug contain gluten?  Sides affects were extreme nausea and loss of appetite, and frequent bowl movements.  When I stopped Forteo and followed a gluten-free diet all side affects disappeared.

column2: sceondfifty, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Only noted side effect thinning hair and nails.  No pain.  Have shown significant bone gain- went from osteoporosis to osteopenia in 18 mo. I run and go to gymn 4-6 days per week. No weight gain.

column2: trish106, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had headaches everyday.  Increased joint and back pain. My hair always looked good until it started Forteo and Cymbalta now it is frizzy and dead looking. I have been on Forteo for 1 year, Dr wants me on it for 18 months before doing another Bone Density Test.   Really?

column2: Mickey, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug since January.  So far, I have had a few bent needles which the pharmacy replaced. Also, I have been getting red spots on my legs and headaches, and sinus probles.  I don't know if this is the forteo or the enbrel I'm on too.  Has anyone else had this type of reaction?

column2: ks, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After 2+ weeks I developed severe muscle cramping in hands, legs, feet as well as overall acute joint and muscle pain.  I felt as though I had a severe flu or had been run over by a truck...stopped the shots and was better in 36 hrs. and great in 48 hrs.  Waited a week and tried it again (doc had requested) and by the 3rd day the same symptoms appeared, stopped and felt great within 36 hrs.  Now I am afraid to try Prolia.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 71 year old male in my 2nd month of taking Forteo. Some dizziness. Need comments from other males.

column2: Allie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It is super easy to inject.The only thing Is how uneasy it is to keep it cold when travelling.

column1: Osteoporosis in Men due to Deficient Function of Testis
column2: George, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: frequent bowel acivity

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Heart Rate got very high for days after taking for about 2 weeks

column2: Jan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Forteo for 11 months with mild joint pain & some calf/foot pain but nothing too bad.  My biggest complaint is that my hair on my head it thinning a lot.  Does anyone know if it comes back after stopping treatment?  This could make me stop using Forteo.  Please let me know if you have experience this.

column2: Kayla, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 3 months the side effects were unbelievable,joint pain, stomach pain, hair loss, anxiety increase, hunger increase,dizzy spells, mood swings, throat felt full or swelled at times--I decided to stop Forteo myself, The Docter didn't approve, of course, but as I said to her, she should try it herself, and maybe it would change her mind about perscribing it. I now take an awsome, Holistic approach, and feel I can take control with the proper Calcium,Mag,and D combination---healthy eating, exercising,bone building herbal teas, and many other supplements. I recommend a visit with a certified Nutritionist/Herbalist so you can take control of your bone regrowth-instead of Forteo decreasing your daily quality of life---Good Luck to all of you---And may God bless you with healthy bones!!!

column2: John, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: I am the care giver and posted previously how my wife began to have uncontrollable jerkin of the arfms and legs afte being on Forteo for approx 13 months.  ER visits were a waste of time and doctor accused wife of "acting out"  Wife was admitted to a senior care center and placed on Zyprexa and Forteo injections were stopped.  This cured the problem.  Forteo should be taken off of the market before it drives someone insane.

column2: may, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I'm surprised no one has been upset about risk of bone cancer. Took for little over year, constant nausea, weight down 30+ pounds, ther wasn't anywhere that I didn't ache and hurt. Stopped taking after bout of nausea and vomiting. Feel 100% better now. Haven't been back to docs, only my prime care and GI doc and they are always in a hurry, so nothing was said.

column2: linD, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: At 1st, everything was fine. After 4 mo's, I began having leg & joint pain. It's getting worse. I've gained a ton of weight, too.

column2: susieq, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: have been on forteo since 3-2010 have joint and leg pain and abdominal cramping

column2: Fran, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for 6 mos.  It has helped with a lot of pain, but it may be causing other pains I haven't had before.  My legs hurt more and my low back.  I have gained a few pounds and seem to be hungry a lot.  This has just started the last six weeks or so.  I am real curious if anyone else has felt it increased their appetite.  I will have a bone density again next month.  I have also been able to get off a 75 mg. pain patch I had been on for a few years.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on Foreto for 11 months.  I stopped taking for 2 months due to extreme fatigue, muscle/joint pain, difficulty concentrating/fogginess.  My doctor thinks I may have been overdosing (5'2" 110lb) with the full dose and she then rigged the pen so that I can draw out only a small amount (little less than half) so that I do not experience the extreme side effects.  Due for a Bone Density test next month and hopeful for good results.  I am extremely pleased that I have a doctor who understands and is willing to work with me.

column2: gbsn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Actual Reason for Taking This Treatment: Developed osteoporosis prior to menopause, it's "all in the family".Length of Treatment: 3 mos, no repeat bone density yet.  Pre-Treatment 24-hour urine study showed rapid bone loss, age 61.Pre-Treatment thyroid profile was normal.Skin dryness has increased since I began treatment with Forteo.  Forteo seems to cause increased urination even when I cut back on fluid intake - diuretic effect with me?  Long-term plan must include bisphosphamate or other once the 18-24 months of Forteo is completed.  It bothers me wondering, what next?  Fosamax that previously caused esophageal pain/oral ulcers?  Must have f/u plan to not lose benefit of Forteo which has not been explained to be by Bone Mineral & Metabolism clinic doctor.  One can always hope for new better drugs.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 52 yrs old and have had 5 compression fractures since January 2010. I have had Reclast 1 dose in April 2010 then had another fracture in March 2011. Was put on Forteo Sub-Q to see if there could be any improvement. Within a week or so of Forteo treatment I had increased joint pain & was not able to sleep thru the night. I thought maybe this is just an initial reaction & it would level out & improve with time. Was I ever wrong. I have taken Forteo Sub-Q daily for about 6 weeks now & cannot take the pain or sleepless nights any more. I have decided with my Dr., to Stop Forteo & to try something else. The pain has gotten out of control & not sleeping is very draining. I would not advise anyone to continue this med if their pain increased as mine has. Be sure to inform your Dr. ASAP. Don't suffer.

column2: gitensha, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Have been taking Forteo for 46 days for osteoporosis in my lower spine. Beginning with the first injection I experienced headache, queasy stomach and fatigue. These symptoms lasted all day, I felt exhausted,  sluggish, hard to work  I do not believe my Dr. listens to me, stating "I've never taken a patient off Forteo."  However, she suggested that I stop the drug for a few weeks to see how I feel.  After skipping  one dose I feel like myself again - no headache, no fatigue, clear headed, able to eat.  After taking both Actonal and Foxomax, Forteo was my last option.  Now I don't know where to turn.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I HAD TO RATE THIS DRUG WITHOUT EVER USING IT. THE REASON BEING I'M SUPPOSED TO START TAKING IT IN THE NEAR FUTURE. MY QUESTION IS, THIS I GET BAD SIDE EFFECTS - HOW LONG AFTER YOU STOP USING IT DO THE SIDE EFFECTS GO AWAY? o16stq

column2: SSSSS, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After four months, I developed pains in both elbows, both knees and both upper arms.  My doctor is so enamored with Forteo that she will not consider the possibility that this drug is causing the pain.

column2: J, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My dr has rec that I start this drug-I'm already taking phosamax (sp). Reason for taking: osteoporosis from spinal cord injury and partial paraplegia. Am trying to decide if I should start taking forteo or not. I am afraid of the side effects. I am a 65 yr old male.

column2: Ollie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Easy to use. However, I have been having muscle pain in my legs since I first started 5 months ago.. I do not know how effective it is as I have not had a new bone density scan.

column2: KathiA, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: on 3rd month now. Had bone pain due to side effects of Cancer treatment. Pain increased significantly after starting Forteo. Pain in hands, feet, neck; occasional Sharp stabbing pains in joints. Don't yet know if it has been effective. Would like to discuss with others.

column2: Marcy, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: Had bone density test done after 1 year of being on drug & showed a decline in bone density--Not increase

column2: chowery883, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: when I started injecting myself daily my pelvis and lower back were'nt hurting over time (it crep upon me) I only have about 45 minutes a day without pain that's when i awake in the morning. about three months after stopping my pain is there only if I'm real active.  needless to say I don't take it anymore

column2: B Webb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking the Foreteo about 31/2 months. I woke up evety night to unberable leg and foot cramps.  Now I get up about 2 am for the injectio.  No cramps.

column2: forteo, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My first bone density text ater 20 mos. of use increased my bone density reading from -2.5 to -1.3. Have 3 mos. more to go.

column2: kenn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After a few days i am experiencing very painful leg cramps and hip pain 9 on a 1-10 scale.  Is this normal?   I am 43 years old and have 5 fractures from osteoperosis

column2: chia6000, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Great Experience so far-no side effects really. Injecting self is not bad at all. Have not had bone scan yet to determine its effectiveness, but SOOO MUCH BETTER than Actonel or Bonniva in terms of side effects.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Im a 49yr old man who has osteoperosis for the last 14 yrs do to long tern cortisteroid use.ive reacted negatively to years on fosamax so have been on forteo now for 2 months.the first two weeks were very rough.i was very dizy stomach upset very tired chills,also had increased joint pain and some swelling in my legs.these have gone away as of now except being dizzy once in a while and a slight increase in joint pain.overall now i dont really have any issues taking this drug.hopefully it will continue this way. 12/21/10

column2: Grams, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Ever since I began taking Forteo about 6 months ago, I have been having muscle weakness, pain in my hands, wrists, ankles and feet.  The pain goes from feet to hands, back and forth.  It feels like muscle spasms.  The pain comes and goes pretty regulary.  I would like to know if this is typical.  It really concerns me.

column2: margaret schrank, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I experienced a lot of constipation which I (hope) has settled down with daily use of Miralax. However, either the Foteo or the Miralax make me consistantly nauseous (like being PG... I am 75!)  However, my constant runny nose when I am upright and much stuffiness when I am prone is driving me crazy.  I want out!I broke 1/2 of a vertabra in a middle of the night fall in Spring and have been on Forteo for 9 months.Insurance will not pay for another MRI for 2 years.

column2: kathy, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I experienced weight gain (a pound a month); mouth sores; deminished sex drive; depression; restless legs, to name a few.

column2: pm112061@yahoo.com, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i am a 49 yr old man who is about to start taking forteo for osteoperosis.i have had 9 fractures since 1996 and landed in a whellchair for almost 7 yrs.i have been on fosamax for years and it has not been effective.also my body doen not seem to want to absorb vit D and my levels are almost non existant even with high doses i have been taking.so now the doc has put me on this drug.Im reading all the negative side affects both men and woman are having and it is freaking me out a bit.i would like to hear from some of you men and or woman who have been on this drug for a while so i can get some better info on what i need to do,

column2: StacyB, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After the extreme fatigue, flu-like symptoms and joint pain caused by Actonel, the injection wasn't too bad.  Red welt at injection site stayed most of the day, but not painful.  After 3 months developed very painful lump in my armpit.  Dr took me off.  Tried it again 2 months later and the lump came right back.  Dr refused to believe the lump was caused by Forteo....what do they know anyway unless they try it themselves.

column2: Brenda, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken forteo for 4 months. Increased joint and bone pain, loss of hair on my head, hair growth on my face, lump in arm pit, leg cramps, constipated, very very tired. back pain, full feeling in my neck near my thyroid. I have stopped the shot, and will discuss this with my doctor this week. side effects are to much for me to take. Felt better before taking forteo.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I took these shots every day for 2 years.  It stopped working about 8 months ago.  I kept taking it.  My bones are worse than before.  I have NO bone density in my back.Help

column2: Emma Clare, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started the Forteo injections December 09. Although the injections were easy to administer,within two weeks the side effects were overwhelming, fatigue,severe pain in joints,muscle weakness,swollen face,difficulty swallowing,food would not digest, increased blood pressure, memory loss, nausea, chronic diarrhea, severe headaches,pain in top of head, weepy, disoriented,loss of appetite, flu like symptoms. After one month I was taken off the medication by the Endocrologist. The severe joint pain subsided after a few weeks along with most of the other symptoms,although the digestive issues and chronic diarrhea continued. After a 12 pound weight loss I was referred to a Gasteroenterologist. I was diagnosed with gastroparesis. The gastroenterologist has suggested that drugs that are used to treat bone loss have contributed to digestive issues. I had no digestive issues before starting the Forteo. I have also experienced extreme hair loss and issue with my thyroid gland. I have experienced issues with my heart also and a recent stress test came back abnormal.I think this drug should be taken off the market. The long term side effects I continue to experience from this medication 11 months later far outweigh any positive affects on my bone loss. I still do not know the long term affect on my thyroid function and heart issues.

column2: skygypc, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have used 12 "pens" with only slight improvement in my six month dexa-scan.  I too, have experienced weight gain and severe muscle cramping in my calves at night.  So much so, that I was prescribed Bacloven for relief.  The worst side effect however, was severe cracking of the skin on both my hands and feet.  I am discontinuing Forteo to see if my symptoms improve AND most importantly for the financial burden taking this medication has caused me.  No help from the Forteo-Connect, as I make more than $1600 a month.  Are you kidding me?  At $1000 a month out of pocket expense since I am in the Medicare donut hole, that leaves me a whopping $600 a month to live on!

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 26 year old male, so it was a huge suprise finding out of my bone density loss. My doctor tested my calcium levels, D, and other blood tests, with no conclusion. Ive only been on Forteo for a month, have noticed severe pain in old injuries (my knee, shoulder, wrist) which healed up fin in the past, but are intense now. I have a feeling that Forteo is just a bandaid covering a underlying problem. I also tested my Testosterone levels and they are normal and slightly high. Checked my thyroid in the past year or so. Any advice or theorys would be great.

column2: Joyce34, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 75 year old female, and I started on Forteo May 26, 2010, and nine days later had chest pains which took me to the ER. They found nothing. A week or so later I had Atrial fibrillation, for which I was put on warfarin, and high blood pressure which I now take medication. Several days later had terrible chest pains and shortness of breath, and found I had pericardial effusion for which I was hospitalized and had to have the fluid drained off. I was put on Digoxin for heart rhythm, and developed a toxic reaction to that, and ended up in ICU. Soon after that I developed a pleural effusion and hospitalized again. By then I had been off of the Forteo for 4 weeks, and things started looking better, but have had to take prednisone for several weeks, and also colchicine for the pericarditis. No one will admit it was the Forteo, but I will not be taking it again.

column1: Osteoporosis in Men due to Deficient Function of Testis
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Reggie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was 50 years old when I developed a stress fx in one hip and had it surgically repaired.  While recouperating from the first surgery the other hip developed a stress fx and was also repaired.  I am not post-menopausal.  After much testing and a bone biopsy it was determined I had low turnover osteoporosis and Forteo therapy was started.  I have not had any side effects or broken any bones after 13 months of Forteo therapy.  I would recommend the drug.  My sister was also recently diagnosed with low turnover osteoporosis and is now on Forteo too.  She has not had any side effects.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 55 year old postmenopausal female. I took Forteo for 27 months until June, 2010. I went from a score of -2.9 to a score of -2.1. Just today my doctor told me how happy he is with the result. I had no noticeable side effects during treatment.

column2: John, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: Wife has ben taking Forteo injections for just over a year and since3 that time has had severe anxiety problems and involuntary jerking of the body, arms and legs.  To may visits to Emergency room only to have doctors say they can find nothing wrong,

column1: Osteoporosis in Men due to Deficient Function of Testis
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Used for two years. It helped with bone density but, now have pain in joints and back. Developed severe case Peyronie Disease while taking this drug, although it is not listed as a side effect. Not sure it should be used on men.

column2: shelley, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with osteoporosis 5 years ago. Actinol did not work as I did not absorb it.  Have been on forteo for 3 months.  Have had many side effects of hip, knee, jaw, ankle and back pain exacerbating sciatica.Easy to use. No problems with injections.  I need to stay on this drug.  Please advise if you have any suggestions how to cope with these side effects. We are all in this together to help support one another.  I look forward to hearing coping strategies.

column2: Jo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: been on it for 13 months; have reservations after reading researech.Wouldliek to hear others opinions.

column2: kattmaven, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for 15 months - insurance won't pay for another bone scan until I am done taking it so don't know how effective it will be.   I tried Fosamax, Boniva and Actonel but got ulcerations in stomach and esophagus so dr. put me on this.   I hope it's working.  It's been very easy to use.   The only side effect I have seen is a week ankle but not sure if the drug has caused that.

column2: freespirit, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Very effective with increased bone density after I had been on it for 2 yrs.I was on this for the full 2 years and an extra 3 or 4 months.  I went from osteporosis in my 1st bone density test to osteopenia with my last bone density test.  My results showed improvement in all areas including my neck which I had to have surgery on by a neuro-surgeon on section C5-C-6 to repair damage to my spinal cord and had severe compression on my spinal cord in my neck.  I did not have any side affects from this RX.  The only thing I could not do was give myself the injections due to my fear of needles.  My husband gave them to me and I am 5'4" and weigh approx. 120ish pounds so had the injections in my upper thigh as I have very little fatty areas.It is also very expensive but our insurance company covered it all except of the co-payment that went from $15 to $25 a month.  This RX was aobut $700 or more per month.

column2: calygirl09@hotmail.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: my legs and back doesnt hurt has much

column2: clygirl09@hotmail.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: less aching in the legs and back

column2: mrsc120, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have just started the treatment. Would like to hear from some that have been on in for awhile.

column2: Norma, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have taken this drug for 7 months. I am not really qualified to rate effectiveness as I have not had a scan since starting. I am experiencing change in heart rate and anxiety levels. Heart beat seems to be irregular according to my monitor. I started experiencing this after taking for about 2 weeks.  Don't know if this is related to drug or something I will ask my Dr. on the next visit.  Just wanted to know if anyone else has had this same experience.

column2: Forteo,  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started using Forteo in July 2009.  I'm told I shopuld be on it for 2 years.  Of concern to me is the dry cough that I now have.  Is this SERIOUS side affect, or just bothersome?  Previously I used Fosamax for many, many years with no improvement for my osteoporsis.  Us the dry cough enough of a reason to discontinue Forteo?  Please advise.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My grandmother has alzheimers and I would NOT RECOMMEND.  She was taking the medication for 1 week and took a turn for the worse.  She could barely talk, she couldn't walk, her legs would just give out on her and she couldn't comprehend what we were saying to her.  We took her off the medication and the symptoms have gone away.  She is now walking and can hold a conversation.  We have talked to a few other people that had the same types of problems.  I WOULD NOT GIVE TO ANYONE THAT HAS DEMENTIA OR ALZHEIMER.

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: Since starting this drug in April o9 I have more pain in my lower back, hips and knees. the injection site always leaves a red welt that stays for about 12 hours.  I have had weight gain and bloating with bouts of diarrhea or constapation. My dry skin is even drier and the texture even where I don't inject seems to have changed, not quite a rash but similar.  The last two weeks I have had pain in the top of my head. I am stopping forteo, but will continue with calcium and vitamin D.  I hope to feel better soon.

column2: tam1026, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been od Forteo now for 3-months..I was fine at first.Now,I am having severe pain in my joints..My hands are swelling and the pain is just to hard to deal with..I know I need a good medicine to help me with my osteoporosis. But, after all these unexplainable pains even in my head ! I will have to stop the Forteo..I recommend there should be futher testing on the drug.

column2: freespirit, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was on Forteo for 2 yrs. and 3 months.  I never experienced any side affects and since I only weigh about 125 pounds with very little fat my husband gave me the injections daily in my upper thigh area (only area with some extra fat).  My last bone density test showed Osteopenia instead of the Osteoporosis which I did have.  I was very pleased with the results and stayed on the medication over the 2 yrs. but not without some fears since there had been no studies for using it over 2 yrs, and is only recommended for 2 years.  I also had surgery on my spinal cord in my neck where I had some severe damage to section C5-C6 in my neck.  I did have quite a bit of improvement in my neck also after being on this medication for a little over 2 years.  I was considering staying on it for 3 yrs. but after talking to the company that made the drug, they did not recommend it.  But I had none of the side affects some had.  My only problem was I could not give myself the injection due to my fear of needles.  I was very impressed and pleased with the results I got from Forteo.  I am glad my Dr. prescibed it and our insurance covered it as it is such an expensive RX (approx. $600 a month) we would mot have been able to afford it.  After reading the article on Web MD it is the only one approved by the FDA that really does rebuild bones.  It did for me!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I felt terrible on forteo. I had severe bloating and weight gain. I also got pain in the top of my head. I stopped taking the drug. I will go to my doctors to see what else I can try.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After being on forteo shots for a month I noticed a hugh rash om my chest and back. My doctor gave me a script (prednisone which didn't really help) I was told I might have this rash forever. It does not hurt or itch, so I was taken off forteo.

column2: sl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 62 years old and just finished my two years on Forteo.  My bone density scan showed a 29% increase in my hip, so it was a big improvement. The shot was easy to give and the only side effects I noticed was some weight gain and my calcium level went to 11.4. My doctor said this is normal while on the medicine.  She also recommends I go on Reclast to have continued results.  That makes me a little nervous...but I don't think I have an option.

column2: sandy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have taken forteo since july 09 and I too had been on Actonol/evista and they did not work either.  I have deveoped pains in my head my husband says they are cluster headachs, I do not know if any one else has the same reaction from being on the shotsplease review and let every one knowThankscurious

column2: Grammy, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Froteo for about six months.  This is considered too short a time to even measure any progress.  What I would like to share with readers is some side effects I believe associated with the drug.  One is insomnia, and the other is the tendency to become excessively fearful or anxious at times.  These side effects (or what I believe to be, with good reason,)have been moderate so far, and I am continuing with the drug.

column2: Eve, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I been using this drug for only 3 months. I have noticed periods of achey joint pain especially my hips. Drinking plenty of water and not missing my calcium seems to help. The only alternative for me is reclast and after reading the side effects, I think I will stay with forteo.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had a modest increase in my CBC lymphocyte level. Not sure if there is a relationship to Forteo. Blood pressure went up modestly but persistently.

column2: luci-maye, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am on my  10 month.  I feel so much better,  stronger and able to do a few things I could not do before.   The muscle pain in my legs is nothing like my hip and spine had been.

column2: verna, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have developed GravesDisease and am wondsering if anyone else has had a similar problem.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I will be taking my second dexascan this month for final analysis.   The first scan showed inprovment.Am wondering about what to take next,  since Forteo' is only recommended for 2 yrs.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking Forteo in Nov 2007 so my 2 years is up in a few days. My latest scan showed no bone mass improvement; however, haven't lost any more either. Previously had been on Actonel/Fosamax-continued to lose bone mass--have fractures in upper back. Have experiened joint/muscle pain; however, Drs don't believe the pain is due to Forteo?  They want me to start taking Reclast--have read the reviews and they flat out scare me. Should I do it or not is a big question?

column1: Osteoporosis in Men due to Deficient Function of Testis
column2: MR V.G, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I AM 53  YEAR OLD MALE WAS  VERY  ACTIVE TILL 2  YEARS AGO, WAS ON ACTONEL  FOR  A  1 YEAR  DENSITY TEST GOT  WORSE, I AM GOING TO  START FORTEO NEXT WEEK. IS  ANY MANS  COMENTS  OUT  THERE,  PLEASE  RESPOND.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: As a result of my Endocrine condition (MEN type 1), I no longer have any working parathyroid glands.  After recent surgery, I was left with extreme muscle stiffness and discomfort.  After about two weeks on Forteo, I started feeling better and after a month, I found I can move freely again!  Forteo has filled its roll as a synthetic PTH.  I found it easy to use and am glad to have it!

column2: lindajoy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I just finished my 2yrs. of taking Forteo. (this is all the FDA has approved it for) The side effects I suffered were minor. They included constipation, minor joint pain-especially in my hip, muscle crampness in the calves of my legs and redness at the injection site.  I have truly been blessed.  I glad to be off of it.  My bone density increased a few points but nothing signiicant as I thought.  I was sceptical due to the fact that it had caused bone cancer in lab test on rats and that was due to the higher doses they were given. I wasn't thrilled at having to give myself a shot everyday, but I'm not afraid of needles and it's quick and painless.  I did'nt research this drug as well as I should have, but I recommend others to do more because not everyone's body accept a drug the same way.  We are all different in other ways aren't we?  So our bodies may react differently to the same drug or supplement.  Do your research and decide for yourself, not your doctor, what's best for you.  God Bless You in making the right decision.

column2: Angel, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 54 yr old woman who had a hysterectomy at the age of 39 and I am now on Forteo because by BD was-3.7. I am on it 11 mos. For those of you experiencing bone & muscle pain the first 3-5 mos. are the worst. It does get better, my blood work is fine, my calcium levels & vit. D levels are fine - will have another BD test in Oct. and hopefully my levels will raise. It is just unfortunate for some of us that fall into that donut hole, (I am also paying $827.00 a mo.)that something can't be done about the cost of this drug for the 2 years we have to be on it.

column2: Inspire82, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: my grandma of 82 years old took the medicine via daily injection onto her abdomen, as directed by the doctor.she has only been on this course for 17 days but she is complaining of no strength, legs and arms ache, fatigueshe cannot stand straight and her knees are bent when she tries to stand, indicating no strength.she wasnt like this before starting on FORTEO though. she could still stand straight and walk abit with the aid of a walking frame.but it is because she has serious osteoporisis, her bones are very weak, and it is collasping onto her spinal cord, making her very uncomfortable and cannot sit straight without feeling any pain.hence our specialist doctor recommended this medicine to her.I am worried that her 'no strength, arms legs aching symptoms' are causing her condition to worsen,are her bones gaining mass, even though she is experiencing all these other bad symptoms?would appreciate it i could discuss this with someone who knows more?As i am thinking of stopping to give her this medication because she seems to do doing worse than before starting on FORTEO..thanks...from a worried grandson

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Forteo for 4 months, it is easy to use.  But, my legs and arms ache, it feels like I have the flu all the time.  I will continue to take it because my mother is also on it and it has increased her bone mass. So, hopefully it will do the same for me.

column2: shirley, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: right now i'm having trouble with sores in my mouth.i've been on forteo for 14 months.

column2: Barb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Endocrinologist put me on forteo due to my very poor dexa scores starting in Dec 2007. Blood calcium check was done a few weeks after starting show no loss of calcium.  No dexa scan will be done til Dec 2009.  I am hoping it has improved my bones.  No real side effects from the drug except weight gain especially around mid section and marks from needles.  Some of the injections seem to hurt more and cause some bruising.  Other than the hassel of self injections I have not noticed any side effects.I will rerate this drug once I have completed the 24 month injections. If you want to ask questions about my experience or are going to start forteo I'll be happy to relay the information that I know

column2: babe, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I just finished 25 months of treatment-Dexa scan improved by 3 to 7 percent in hips and lumbar spine. Decreased bone denisity in rt. forearm-reason unknown. I had muscle cramps-severe first three months then less severe thoughtout treatment. Well worth it

column2: eca, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have used Forteo for nearly 2 years due to significant bone loss.  My endocrinologist and internist recommended this drug because of results of bone scans and due to 2 fractures in one year.  I am anxious to stop use of it sonn because I feel it has contributed to weight gain, body mass.  I'm 5 feet, 5 inches and now weigh 140 pounds.  I also have Celiac Sprue and take 50000 units 1x per week of prescription vitamin D.

column2: atlgal, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Forteo for 16 months. After 9 months my bone scan showed an increase from -3.0 to -2.5, which I think is a great result for such a short period of time. I hate needles, but I think the results are worth it. The only side effects I've experienced are sometimes it bruises or bleeds, but not often.

column2: knighly, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have only been using Forteo for two months. I have had four fractures in 3 years, so my doctor perscribed Forteo. No side effects at this time.

column2: Simba, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I rated effectiveness a 3 because I have not been retested yet. I have been taking Forteo for 7 months with no side effects, discomfort, etc. I do know that my pain from 'roaming' osteoarthitis pain has been greatly reduced as have the frequency of the pain.

column2: yankeerose, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for 1 year and my T score has only increased from -3.3 to -2.7 and now my calcium level is too high causing extreme fatigue and muscle weakness. I am currently off the medicine awaiting an appointment with the Dr

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 32 year-old female. I had a hysterectomy when I was 27. My bone density numbers were -3 and I tripped at home and broke my arm. So my doctor insisted I needed Forteo.  I am 5  months into it and find it very easy to give the injections. The only side effect I've had is a little achyness in my joints, but ibuprofen takes the ache away.  I don't know that's it's working as I don't get another bone scan for 6 more months.  Everything has been good with Forteo for me. Expensive, but is cheaper than a broken bone and being off work for 3 months.  I have actually been able to be more active since starting this.

column2: Kathleen                                , 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: I have taken Forteo for three months. After years of successful treatment with Actonel, my BD decreased to -3 everywhere.  I am now beginning to experience pain in the leg and ankle joints,leg muscle cramps.  This is not constant pain.  It seems to "roam" my body from time to time. There is now also extreme fatigue and loss of energy overall.  At first ,I thought it might be depression [which I have treated for successfully for years],but it feels more like a "slow-to-go away" flu.  Have not talked to Doc yet.  Will give it a few weeks more to see if it abates.  My knees seem to be the primary target most days.

column2: Lois, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Due to menapause and Cortisone I have been taking the shots for 6 months.  I do not know if it is helping.  Will not have another bonedesity for another 18 months.  Shots are easy, nausea has gone away, replaced by bone pain and muscle cramps.  Have not broken anything for the past 6 months, which is a good thing. Sure hope it is working, good luck everyone.

column2: caser74, 25-34 Male  (Caregiver)
column9: my grandmather has spinal desase,has broken her hip. Would this medication benfit her ? She is is 84  and has a very hard time getting around.Please let me know or about any other medication.Sincerely  CASEY DENNY my e-mail is caseyrocketman@yahoo.com

column2: Kim, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have RA and because of the use of prednisone, I ended up in the hospital for a month (without surgery) because I fractured my back and hip and had to have intensive PT to even be able to turn over or sit up. I have been taking Forteo for 3 months now and have really not experienced any side effects and the shot is easy to give myself. The only problem I have noticed is that my hair seems to be falling out more than before I took this drug. I have a lot of hair, so it's not noticeable. I truly think this drug is helping me because my back and hip pain is now gone. I don't know if it is because my bones started growing back or PT that I go to 2 times per week over the last 6 months. Either way, I think the drug has been helpful.

column2: Kath, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm 56 years old and had a hysterectomy at age 40. I was taking Actonel for 5 years and suddenly my scores from my dexascan dropped so drastically that the doctor expected me to be breaking bones as I walked. I have 3 grandchildren so far and want quality of life as I get older so I decided to take Forteo shots. I want to dance at my oldest granddaughters wedding in the years to come, not be pushed in a wheelchair. I've only been using Forteo for 3 weeks so I don't know how effective it is. It is much easier to use than I thought it would be. The ony side effects Ihave had so far are bruising at the injection site twice. Also, in th epat week the injection site has become red and very slightly raised. It doesn;t hurt...just looks strange.

column2: jan, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Took Forteo for 9 months. Little improvement according to the bone-density scan. Fell into "donut hole" after 3 months. Forteo cost went from 771.00 to over 900.00 in two months time. Good luck, hope you're weatlthy

column2: Cynthia, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 56 years old and experieced menopause produced by hysterectomy at age 30. I found out that I have osteoporosis and have been taking Forteo for almost 5 months now. No symptoms until the beginning of the 3rd month, when muscle and bone pain began occuring in the lower leg, ankle, feet, thighs, and all along the arm, from shoulder down. I am extremely fatigued all the time and feel like I have the flu. Could Forteo be causing this? I don't think there is enough information about side effects out there for us, and at this point I think I'd rather have another broken foot than continue to take a medication that costs me in excess of $800 per month and makes me feel so badly (at least I'm beginning to think it's associated)! Just curious to know if anyone else feels the same. Have you experienced these symptoms - have you discussed them with your doctor and what has the doctor recommended or said? Thanks for sharing ladies!

column2: nisse71, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have just started this medicine 23 days in, I have had severe muscle cramps and joint pain. I refuse to give up on this and have found that if I can bear it to walk in place helps with the pain. Also I was taking the shot at night and laying down and that is when it hurt the most. Now I take in the morning and walk in place for as long as i can stand the pain due to other back and bone issues not allowed on treadmill can't walk very far but I am getting the weight bearing exercise holding on to a chair and walk.

column2: Angie from Austin, Tx., 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was  treated for years with Evista and Actonel.  However, every year my bone density test revealed worse results.  My doctor recomended Forteo.  I put if off for one year being fearful of bone cancer.  She kept insisting and I used it for 6-1/2 months.  I had no side effects, but when I had a blood test,  the levels of alkaline phosphatase were very elevated.  I immediately stopped using this drug.  I just went to my doctor for a bone density test and there was some improvement and after 6 months the alkaline phostase had decreased substantially, but the combined number was still out-of-range and the levels in the bone was at the top of the expected range.  She wants me to go back on Forteo, but I am very reluctant to do so.  I am more willing to wait for the new drug from Amgen (Denosumab), since I have not had a fracture since I was a little girl.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor insisted that this was the drug for me.  I took it for 16 days.  Developed SEVERE nausea, indigestion, fatigue, chest pain.  No antacid would help.  After stopping the injections, began to improve in two or three days.  Back to normal self now.  Dr. will not believe drug was cause, but I know my body.  Would not recommend that anyone take it.

column2: Nervouswreck, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a 40 yr old male with steroid inducedOsteoporosis. my BMD level is -4.6 and my doctor put me on Forteo. I've been on it for9 months now, & am now growing really concerned. I am having muscle spasm, & have been living with a head  & neck pain forthe past month now. I go to sleep with the pain, wake up with it, & go through my days with it, and am now having slight jaw pain.The pain goes from a scale of #2 to a #7 then back to #2 or 3 Everyday.My doctor doesn't seem to think it's associated at all with the medicine and just tell me to take yet another prescription for pain. (HELLO..more drugs?I've thankfully have not had any fractures, but am growing extremely concerned with all the talks of Tumors, Cancer, Jaw problems toname a few. I am considering stopping the use of this medicine. Is there a support group out there for us in Fla? I am a Husband, a Father of 3 children ages 7, 9, & 15 and am thinking if I stop & break a bone, I live to see my kids another day. If I get Cancer of the bone my kids would lose their father quite rapidly, & don't know if can risk that. If there anyone out there that may be interested in chatting on line in regards to this dilema or has some information that feels can be useful to memy email is MUNOZCARLOS26@GMAIL.COMThank You.

column1: Osteoporosis in Men due to Deficient Function of Testis

column2: otilla, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Used for 1 year for hypothyroidism. Had to stop because insurance said using for wrong reason.I think it was a money thing! But I took 16 calcium pills a day. When I was on Forteo 3 a day. I really felt good. So now I am back to 16 pills a day and don't feel good most of the time. I wish it was o.k'd . column2: Heather49404, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on the Forteo for 9 months because I have osteoporosis/Degenerative Disc Disease. Had surgury on my neck in March 2008. My beginning experience with Forteo was good, however the last two months I have had bad bouts with the my bowels and lack of appetite. My stomach hurts all the time and I'm not hungry. My bone pain has increased and I now am having problems with pain in my jaw. This bone pain in so severe that it effects my abilitiy to walk. I however did have the bone pain prior to the use of Forteo. Some days my bone pain is worse than others. My doctors give me no explanation for this pain. I have recently stopped taking the Forteo and the bouts with my bowels has disappeared. I am still waiting for the doctor to get back with me as to what I should do now. I also have been taking multi vitamins, calcium w/D 1200 mgs. a day and was told by my doc to also take vitamin D-400 with D3 once a day for my Osteo. All together I'm not to sure as to weather I wan't to continue this medicine or just take a break from it for a month or two. Then try again. Prior to taking Forteo, I was on Boniva. I have had no bone scans done since the use of Forteo. I can only hope that when I go back into the doctors he will help me find out what is causing me to have such severe pain in my legs,hips and feet.Also the jaw pain concerns me. I guesss I worry about possible cancer or pagets disease. Hopefully everthing comes out ok. Best of luck to all of you who are on Forteo.

column2: Barb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: California Medical won't ok my use of this drug even though I scored a -5 on my last bone density test. I used it for a month and was just getting comfortable with the daily injection.

column2: GHRossi, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I fell and broke my back and my shoulder 4 months ago.  I had been treated for premature osteoporosis with hormones and Fosamax for 10 years.  I have been using Forteo injections for the past three months.  I am hopeful that it will help my density plus avoid future fractures.  I am concerned because I am finding that I feel tired and nauseous most of the time and I am suspicious that my shoulder pain is increasing from the injections. I am not certain of any of this and am very confused.  Has anyone else felt sick and tired and a bit down as a side effect of the injections?  My doctor says she doesn't think it is the drug but I skipped one day and felt so much better.  I have started injecting at night now and hope that helps.

column2: R2, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I'M 45; MALE. I HAVE OSTEOPROSIS FOR THE PAST 15 YEARS. I USE FORTEO FOR TWO YEARS; I HAVEN'T ANY FRACTURES OR ANY MAJOR SIDE EFFECTS. THE LASTS BONE DENSITY SCANS; READS THAT SOME IMPROVEMENT IN HIPS AND SPINE [LOW BACK L1 -L5] INCREASING SOME BONE MASS. HELPS ME MORE THAN ANY OTHER MEDICATION WITH OR WITHOUT FDA APPROVAL. KNOW I'M ON FOSAMAX 70MG WEEKLY UNTIL I CAN USE FORTEO AGAIN.

I am not convinced it is a safe drug.  I would like to continue to research this and ascertain that this drug is safe.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was taking Forteo injections for 2 years, maximum. column9: I BROKE MY SACRUM 5 MONTHS AFTER BEING ON IT.

column2: Peggy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took forteo for 1 year for my hypothyroid condition. I don't have a parathyroid. It worked great. I went from 17 calcium pills a day to 3. column2: Shirley, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am 12 months into my Forteo injections, I have moved to a new state and I have been unable to find a doctor capable of monitoring my treatment. Can anyone help?

column2: Sher, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just started taking this Jan 08, Have already broken a hip (10/07)and can not take the oral meds. I am a nurse and did the research on the drug, it is easy to inject and have had no side effects but the bone scan in Dec. 08 will tell the tale. On Xray my bones are quite thin and you can see through them.

column2: caluco23, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Less pain  and less tiredness. easy to adm. the medication. I hope that work for ever.

column2: cathy0828, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Forteo for 16 months and a recent Dexascan showed my density to be the same as when I started.  I have received no explantion from Drs why this is.  I plan on stopping this shot at the first of the year.

column2: BonnieG, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My bone density improved greatly with the use of this product, however, the side effects are horrendous.  I am weak, dizzy, sluggish, very tired all the time.  I am going to stop taking it.

column2: beapanow, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Bone density is worse. I would not recommend.

column2: plunk, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have used this product for 18 months with wonderful results. Shots were simple to give and I have had no side effects.

column2: whvh520@dslextreme, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more
column9: Forteo has caused deep caries of  the roots of my teeth

column2: Caremme, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have steroid induced osteoporosis.  I have been taking Forteo for a little over a year with improvement in bone density.  I have slight injection sight pain sometimes and also experienced some muscle spasms that have mostly gone away with continued treatment.

column2: Carol, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took  this drug for one year and started having pain down my left arm under my arm pit and my chest. I stpped taking it and the pain stopped. I did have a 24% increase in bone mass in one year except for my wrist, which got worse.

column2: WindBlown, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This drug has worked great for me.  I haven't had any side effects and the injection is painless and simple.
